alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 30 at 3:01PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM HST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 430 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 259 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over interior portions of the West Maui Mountains continues to fall at rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour, while showers over Upcountry areas have diminished. Showers and thunderstorms over interior west Maui may lead to rises in streams, even in areas where no rain is occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kahului, Lahaina, Waihee, Waiehu, Wailuku, Olowalu, Waikapu, Kahakuloa, Kaanapali, Napili-Honokowai, Kapalua, Honokohau, Maalaea, Launiupoko, Ukumehame Beach Park and Honolua Bay. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 430 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
